docs.abstract: I almost feel sorry for Mitt Romney.
docs.snippet: I almost feel sorry for Mitt Romney.

docs.lead_paragraph: Inspired by his inability to buy a printer ribbon on the Fourth of July, Mr. Stemberg and a former rival in the grocery industry, Leo Kahn, teamed up to found Staples in 1986.

headline.main: Thomas G. Stemberg, Who Joined a Rival to Found Staples, Dies at 66
headline.print_headline: Thomas G. Stemberg, Who Joined a Rival to Found Staples, Dies at 66

docs.abstract: Thomas G Stemberg, co-founder and chairman of Staples, largest discount retailer of office products worldwide, dies at age 66.
docs.snippet: Inspired by his inability to buy a printer ribbon on the Fourth of July, Mr. Stemberg and a former rival in the grocery industry, Leo Kahn, teamed up to found Staples in 1986.

docs.lead_paragraph: Some features are still to be added as the government tries to improve the website used to help people select health plans through the Affordable Care Act.

headline.main: Health Law’s Revamped Site, HealthCare.gov, to Debut on Sunday
headline.print_headline: Federal Officials to Unveil Retooled HealthCare.gov

docs.abstract: Cost and benefits of 2016 health plans under Affordable Care Act are unveiled on HealthCare.gov, but features allowing search for plans covering specific doctors or medications are not yet viewable; purchasing of plans begins November 1.
docs.snippet: Some features are still to be added as the government tries to improve the website used to help people select health plans through the Affordable Care Act.

docs.lead_paragraph: While it is far preferable for retirees to remain at home as they age, the choices and costs can be daunting.

headline.main: Learning the Unfamiliar Language of Home Care
headline.print_headline: The Unfamiliar Language of Home Care

docs.abstract: Retiring column; most aging adults will need health care assistance eventually, but few plan for it; most prefer to stay at home, but it is difficult to make it work.
docs.snippet: While it is far preferable for retirees to remain at home as they age, the choices and costs can be daunting.

docs.lead_paragraph: With health savings accounts and flexible spending accounts, workers can put tax-free money aside for medical expenses.

headline.main: Saving on Taxes While Saving for Health Care Costs

docs.snippet: With health savings accounts and flexible spending accounts, workers can put tax-free money aside for medical expenses.

docs.lead_paragraph: Several sites seek to act as kind of a Dropbox for the hereafter, storing messages meant for a decedent’s family and friends, like advice for children at life milestones.

headline.main: Digital Messages for Loved Ones From Beyond the Grave
headline.print_headline: Digital Messages for Loved Ones From Beyond the Grave

docs.abstract: Paul Sullivan Wealth Matters column says new cloud-bases services offer written and video messages from deceased persons to heirs; lawyers say they could become problematic if not used correctly.
docs.snippet: Several sites seek to act as kind of a Dropbox for the hereafter, storing messages meant for a decedent’s family and friends, like advice for children at life milestones.

docs.lead_paragraph: Republicans in the U.S. House of Representatives approved legislation on Friday targeting President Barack Obama's Affordable Care Act that, like 60 other attempts before it, stands little chance of becoming law.

headline.main: For 61st Time, House Passes Anti-Obamacare Bill
headline.print_headline: For 61st Time, House Passes Anti-Obamacare Bill

docs.snippet: Republicans in the U.S. House of Representatives approved legislation on Friday targeting President Barack Obama's Affordable Care Act that, like 60 other attempts before it, stands little chance of becoming law.

docs.lead_paragraph: Republicans rammed legislation through the House on Friday that would demolish major pillars of President Barack Obama's health care law and halt Planned Parenthood's federal payments. If the bill can surmount GOP divisions in the Senate and reach the White House, it faces one guaranteed fate — death by veto.

headline.main: GOP Bill Would Gut Health Law, Halt Planned Parenthood Money
headline.print_headline: GOP Bill Would Gut Health Law, Halt Planned Parenthood Money

docs.lead_paragraph: Premiums are expected to rise in many parts of the country as a new sign-up season under President Barack Obama's health care law starts Nov. 1. But consumers have options if they shop around, and an upgraded government website will help them compare.
